metadata.title: Huawei, COMSATS University sign MoU to develop technical vocational training labs

content.article_body: ISLAMABAD, Jan 02 (APP):Huawei Technologies Pakistan Pvt Ltd, a global leader in information and communications technology (ICT), and COMSATS University Islamabad have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) aimed at fostering collaboration in the fields of technology. The agreement was signed during a ceremony held at the office of Huawei Technologies in Islamabad said a news release. Federal Minister of Science and Technology, Dr. Khalid Maqbool Siddiqui and key representatives from both organizations attended the event. This partnership is set to enhance technical vocational training and skill development to create employment opportunities for students and young technicians by equipping them with the latest ICT technologies. Under the MoU, Huawei will provide COMSATS University Islamabad with equipment and train their resources in delivering the technical training to the attendees of these courses. Initially, this program will commence with the COMSATS University Islamabad, Lahore campus. Subsequently, COMSATS University Islamabad will also help develop a similar facility in Karachi as well. This collaboration is designed to equip students with the necessary skills to thrive in a rapidly evolving digital landscape. Dr. Tahir Naeem, Director (P, D &HRD) at COMSATS University Islamabad, expressed enthusiasm about the partnership: aThis collaboration with Huawei represents a significant step forward in our mission to provide students with a comprehensive education in technology and innovation. We are excited to work together to develop programs that will enhance learning and research capabilities.a Ahmed Bilal Masud, the Director Subsidiary Board at Huawei, emphasized the importance of such collaborations: aAt Huawei, we believe in the power of partnerships to drive innovation. By working with COMSATS University Islamabad, we aim to nurture talent and inspire the next generation of technology leaders.a The MoU will also pave the way for further collaboration between both organizations including knowledge exchange and fostering an environment of innovation that benefits both institutions and the wider community.
content.summary: Huawei Technologies Pakistan and COMSATS University Islamabad have signed an MoU to collaborate on technology and skill development. The partnership aims to enhance technical vocational training and create employment opportunities for students. The program will start in Islamabad and expand to Lahore and Karachi.
